newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: Aluminium Bahrain seeks $85 mln from banks.
newsitem.headline: Aluminium Bahrain seeks $85 mln from banks.

text.p: Aluminium Bahrain (Alba), the Middle East's biggest aluminium producer, said on Wednesday it was seeking an $85 million loan from banks to finance expansion projects.
Alba financial affairs manager Ahmed al-Nuaimi said the projects included expanding a power plant and the building of an 8.9 million dinar ($24 million) terminal to handle liquid pitch.
Earlier this month, Alba said work had started to build the terminal in line with the company's plan to switch to the more environmentally-friendly liquid form of the raw material.

It said the terminal was being built alongside existing facilities handling alumina and petroleum coke. Solid pitch is mixed with petroleum coke to make the anodes used in the production of aluminium.
Nuaimi also said Alba, with an annual production capacity of more than 460,000 tonnes, was expected to repay $1.1 billion in loans it had received from banks by the year 2002.
The Bahraini government holds 77 percent of Alba and Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund owns 20 percent. German group Breton Investments holds three percent.
